meanings.definition: To stir up or provoke (an emotion or reaction)
meanings.sent1: The movie's sad ending reincites tears in the audience.
meanings.sent2: His speech about equality reincites passion in the listeners.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly dance reincites laughter from the children.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist reincites shock in the viewers.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful sunset reincites a sense of wonder in all who see it.

meanings.definition: To rouse to action or renewed activity
meanings.sent1: The coach's pep talk reincites determination in the team.
meanings.sent2: The alarm clock reincites everyone to start their day.
meanings.sent3: The smell of fresh coffee reincites energy in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The inspiring story reincites motivation in the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the national anthem reincites patriotism in the crowd.
